content:
Diagnosis:	Squamous cell carcinoma of larynx, p16 negative

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of radical chemoradiotherapy in March 2024. He has made an excellent recovery from treatment with gradual improvement in swallowing function and voice quality. His weight has stabilized at 78kg, having regained 2kg since completing treatment. He continues to manage a soft diet with occasional use of thickened fluids.

He reports mild ongoing dry mouth but this is improving with regular sips of water. His voice quality continues to improve with support from the speech and language therapy team. He denies any new concerning symptoms.

On examination today, indirect laryngoscopy shows expected post-treatment changes with no evidence of residual or recurrent disease. His neck is soft with no concerning lymphadenopathy.

The plan is to continue regular follow-up. I have arranged a surveillance CT neck and chest for 3 months' time, and we will see him back in clinic with these results. He understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Weight stabilized at 78kg with 2kg regained post-treatment

patient_facts.value: Mild ongoing dry mouth, improving with regular sips of water
Improving voice quality with speech therapy support
Indirect laryngoscopy shows expected post-treatment changes with no evidence of residual or recurrent disease
Soft neck with no concerning lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma post chemoradiotherapy. Excellent recovery with improving symptoms and no evidence of disease on examination
Good clinical response with improvement in swallowing function and voice quality
Surveillance CT neck and chest in 3 months
Review in clinic with CT results
